item.question: What did the Israelites do in Egypt with their feet so that their crops would grow?
Before the Israelites could enter the promised land, the priests had to place the soles of their feet where?
item.answerD: in the waters of the Jordan

item.question: The Psalmist prophesied of the Messiah that God would make whom his footstool?
In the New Testament, who prophesied of the Messiah that he would guide their feet in the way of peace?
Who did not want Jesus to wash his feet?
A certain lame man's feet were strengthened when he was healed in what place?
Who did not receive enough inheritance to set his foot on?
According to Ephesians 6, we should have our feet fitted with what?
item.answerA: the readiness that comes from the gospel of peace
item.answerC: a piece of the cross of Jesus

item.question: According to the Apostle Paul in Romans (quoting Isaiah), the feet of the wicked are swift to do what?
In Revelation, the 'one like the Son of man' had feet like what?
In Revelation 7, John saw four angels standing on what?
item.answerB: the foot of the cross of Jesus
item.answerC: the four corners of the earth

item.question: In Revelation, who stood on their feet after being dead for three and a half days?
Who gathered up his feet in his bed before he died?
What did Moses put on the big toe of the right foot of Aaron and his sons?
God told the Israelites that he would not give them a foot breadth of the land belonging to which nation?
In the dream Nebuchadnezzar had of an image, what were the feet made of?
In Revelation 2, the Son of God is described as having feet like this.
Balaam's donkey crushed Balaam's foot against what?
According to Moses, what did NOT happen to the feet of the Israelites during the 40 years in the wilderness?
item.answerD: they were subject to athlete's foot

item.question: According to Judges, who had his thumbs and his great toes cut off?
